oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Williams: Beyond the Legend Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of 3. Recording is of the documentary Hank Williams: Beyond the Legend. Documentary is hosted by Kyle Cantrell and includes commentary Roy Acuff (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Lycrecia Williams (daughter).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams Sr.; Minnie Pearl; Roy Acuff; Lycrecia Williams; Kyle Cantrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) An unknown duo hosts a commercial about checking one's cholesterol -- (00:59) Kyle Cantrell discusses New Year's Day in Nashville -- (03:09) Cantrell reveals that Hank Williams Sr. had died that day -- (03:56) Cantrell discusses Hank Williams Sr.'s influence thirty-five years later -- (4:24) I'll Never Get Out of This World Alive (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (06:47) Cantrell introduces the show title: Hank Williams, Beyond the Legend -- (07:11) Fruehauf Trailer commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (08:11) An unknown host delivers an eulogy for Hank Williams Sr. -- (09:24) Cantrell discusses the funeral of Williams Sr. -- (10:14) Roy Acuff performs his eulogy -- (12:06) I Saw the Light (Roy Acuff) -- (13:14) Cantrell reflects on who Williams was while introducing the commercial break -- (14:00) UNICEF commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (15:01) The National Automobile Dealers Association commercial presented by a duo of unknown voices -- (16:00) Music Country Radio Network commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (16:30) Jambalaya (On the Bayou) [featuring Cantrell voice over] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (19:19) Cantrell reflects on William's writing career and the mysteries behind his death -- (21:04) An unknown voice describes the circumstances leading up to Williams Sr.'s death; including how Williams Sr. was given medicine due to his intoxication -- (24:24) Cantrell reflects on how he was given medicine, and how Williams was not as the media portrayed him as -- (25:14) Whistler Truckers Move America (Unconfirmed) [featuring an unknown voiceover] ([Unidentified])-- (26:15) The Nashville Network commercial introducing their upcoming events on New Country -- (27:15) Cantrell reflects on what makes Williams Sr. an interesting character -- (28:35) Cherokee Boogie (recorded for WSM) (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (31:25) Cantrell discusses why people were attracted to Williams Sr.'s singing style -- (32:50) Cantrell introduces the commercial break -- (33:00) Public service announcement about proper driving practices presented by Tom Bodett -- (34:02) The Boy Scouts of America commercial break presented by an Ben Love -- (35:02) Music Country Radio Network commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (35:31) Cantrell introduces Williams young life [featuring Williams Sr. background music] -- (36:54) Minnie Pearl reflects on the time Williams Sr. received a large scar from a fight -- (37:17) Cantrell reflects on Williams Sr.'s parents (specifically Lillie Williams) -- (37:54) The Old Log Train (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (40:14) Goodies Headache Powder commercial presented by Reba McEntire [featuring "How Blue"] -- (41:13) Dello commercial presented by Jackie Robinson -- (42:13) Cantrell discusses when Williams Sr. first tried alcohol and his association with country music -- (45:35) Don Helms jokes about the requirements Williams Sr. required for Helms to join his band -- (46:10) Cantrell discusses how Lillian's relationship with Williams Sr. changed when he met Audrey Williams -- (47:40) Baby, We're Really in Love (Hank Williams) -- (50:11) Cantrell introduces Audrey's daughter (50:26) Lycrecia Williams reflects on Williams Sr.'s alcoholism -- (51:21) Cantrell introduces the commercial break -- (51:32) Co-op Education commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (52:34) [Unknown jingle] -- (53:02) Lycrecia continues to speak on Williams Sr.'s alcoholism -- (53:15) Cantrell introduces the upcoming schedule of the show -- (53:29) The National Cholesterol Education Program commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (54:29) [Unknown Jingle] -- (54:56) Remainder of tape is reversed and includes a rendition of "Blue Christmas;" segment is unrelated to tape
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953. I saw the light; Williams, Lycrecia, 1941-; Pearl, Minnie; McEntire, Reba; McEntire, Reba, 1955-; Acuff, Roy; Acuff, Roy, Jr., 1943-; Cantrell, Kyle;
